data.text: @PHLPublicHealth still using the bad data, huh?  You know you are going to cause people to distrust your data going forward. With the result that they are going to distrust your advice/directives in the future. Not good for a public health department.
@PHLPublicHealth No way your positivity rate is correct.

@PHLPublicHealth You're still publishing the wrong positivity rate. How can we believe your data and metrics mean anything if you can't even get them right minutes after Cheryl announces that the rate is 1.7%?
